descriptions: - Meaning - Components – rules and regulations, attitudes, behaviours, integrity, self confidence, etc. - Importance and benefits of work ethics.

- Meaning of fibre, yarn, fabric, etc. - Classification - Characteristics/properties - Identification - Combinations (blends, mixtures) - Fabrication/construction (weaves, crocheting, knitting) - Finishing treatments.
- Concept - Functions - Classifications e.g. clothes, accessories and cosmetics.

Reasons for studying Clothing and Textiles - Career types e.g. modelling, teaching, dressmaking and tailoring, textiles chemist, textiles designer, etc. - Basic requirements for careers e.g. knowledge, academic qualification, etc.
